config.description: Time period for which the connection must be consistently down for (e.g. doesn't report down-up-down) before concluding failure. Note that long TCP timeouts mean there can be long (e.g. 70 second) delays in noticing a connection refused condition.

policies.name: Follow the Sun

policies.name: Load Balancer
policies.description: Policy that is attached to a pool of "containers", each of which can host one or more migratable "items". The policy monitors the workrates of the items and effects migrations in an attempt to ensure that the containers are all sufficiently utilized without any of them being overloaded.

policies.name: Service Replacer
policies.description: HA policy for replacing a failed member of a group

config.name: failOnRecurringFailuresInThisDuration
config.description: abandon replace if replacement has failed many times within this time interval

config.name: ticker
config.description: A time source (defaults to system-clock, which is almost certainly what's wanted, except in tests)

policies.name: Service Restarter
policies.description: HA policy for restarting a service automatically, and for emitting an events if the service repeatedly fails

config.name: failOnRecurringFailuresInThisDuration

config.name: publicKeyData
config.description: ssh public key string to use (takes precedence over publicKeyFile)

config.name: publicKeyFile
config.description: colon-separated list of ssh public key file(s) to use; if blank will infer from privateKeyFile by appending ".pub"

config.name: region
config.description: region

config.name: runAsRoot
config.description: Whether to run initial setup as root (default true)

config.name: securityGroups
config.description: Security groups to be applied when creating a VM, on supported clouds (either a single group identifier as a String, or an Iterable<String> or String[])

config.name: setup.script
config.description: Custom script to customize a node

config.name: setup.script.vars
config.description: vars to customize a setup.script i.e.: key1:value1,key2:value2

config.name: spec.final
config.description: The actual spec (in a chain) which instantiates a location

config.name: spec.named.name
config.description: The name on the (first) named spec in a chain

config.name: spec.original
config.description: The original spec used to instantiate a location

config.name: stopIptables
config.description: Whether to stop iptables entirely; if true then ssh in to stop the iptables service, as part of machine provisioning

config.name: tags
config.description: Tags to be applied when creating a VM, on supported clouds (either a single tag as a String, or an Iterable<String> or String[];note this is not key-value pairs (e.g. what AWS calls 'tags'), for that see userMetadata)

config.name: templateBuilder
config.description: A TemplateBuilder instance provided programmatically, to be used when creating a VM

config.name: templateSpec
config.description: A jclouds 'spec' string consisting of properties and values to be used when creating a VM (in most cases the properties can, and should, be specified individually using other Brooklyn location config keys)

config.name: user
config.description: user account for normal access to the remote machine, defaulting to local user

config.name: userData
config.description: Arbitrary user data, as a single string in uuencoded format, on supported clouds (AWS)

config.name: userMetadata
config.description: Arbitrary user metadata, as a map (or String of comma-separated key=value pairs), on supported clouds; note often values cannot be null

config.name: userMetadataString
config.description: Arbitrary user data, as a single string, on supported clouds (AWS)

config.name: userName
config.description: Equivalent to 'user'; provided for jclouds compatibility

config.name: vmNameMaxLength
config.description: Maximum length of VM name

config.name: waitForSshable
config.description: Whether and how long to wait for a newly provisioned VM to be accessible via ssh; if 'false', won't check; if 'true' uses default duration; otherwise accepts a time string e.g. '5m' (the default) or a number of milliseconds

config.name: allocatePTY
config.description: whether to allocate PTY (vt100); if true then stderr is sent to stdout, but sometimes required for sudo'ing due to requiretty

config.name: brooklyn.ssh.config.host
config.description: Host to connect to (required)

config.name: brooklyn.ssh.config.port
config.description: Port on host to connect to

config.name: close
config.description: Close the SSH connection after use

config.name: env
config.description: environment variables to pass to the remote SSH shell session

config.name: err
config.description: err

config.name: localTempDir
config.description: The directory on the local machine (i.e. running brooklyn) for writing temp files

config.name: logPrefix
config.description: logPrefix

config.name: noStderrLogging
config.description: whether to disable logging of stderr from SSH commands (e.g. for verbose commands)

config.name: noStdoutLogging
config.description: whether to disable logging of stdout from SSH commands (e.g. for verbose commands)

config.name: out
config.description: out

config.name: parentLocation
config.description: parentLocation

config.name: password
config.description: Password to use to connect

config.name: privateKeyData
config.description: the private ssh key (e.g. contents of an id_rsa or id_dsa file)

config.name: privateKeyFile
config.description: the path of an ssh private key file; leave blank to use defaults (i.e. ~/.ssh/id_rsa and id_dsa)

config.name: privateKeyPassphrase
config.description: the passphrase for the ssh private key

config.name: scpExecutable
config.description: Allows an `scp` executable file to be specified, to be used in place of the default (programmatic) java ssh client

config.name: scriptDir
config.description: directory where scripts should be placed and executed on the SSH target machine

config.name: spec.final
config.description: The actual spec (in a chain) which instantiates a location

config.name: spec.named.name
config.description: The name on the (first) named spec in a chain

config.name: spec.original
config.description: The original spec used to instantiate a location

config.name: sshCacheExpiryDuration
config.description: Expiry time for unused cached ssh connections

config.name: sshExecutable
config.description: Allows an `ssh` executable file to be specified, to be used in place of the default (programmatic) java ssh client

config.name: unique
config.description: Unique ID for the SSH connection

config.name: parentLocation
config.description: parentLocation

config.name: spec.final
config.description: The actual spec (in a chain) which instantiates a location

config.name: spec.named.name
config.description: The name on the (first) named spec in a chain

config.name: spec.original
config.description: The original spec used to instantiate a location
